t: Mark 10
And*p he arose from thence, and cometh into the coasts of Judaea by the farther side of Jordan: and the people resort unto him again; and, as he was wont, he taught them again.
And*p the Pharisees came to him, and asked him, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife? tempting him.
And*p he answered and said unto them, What*r did*r Moses*r command*r you?*r
And*p they said, Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement, and to put her away.
And*p Jesus answered and said unto them, For*r the*r hardness*r of*r your*r heart*r he*r wrote*r you*r this*r precept.*r
But*rp from*r the*r beginning*r of*r the*r creation*r God*r made*r them*r male*r and*r female.*r
For*rp this*r cause*r shall*r a*r man*r leave*r his*r father*r and*r mother,*r and*r cleave*r to*r his*r wife;*r
And*rp they*r twain*r shall*r be*r one*r flesh:*r so*r then*r they*r are*r no*r more*r twain,*r but*r one*r flesh.*r
What*rp therefore*r God*r hath*r joined*r together,*r let*r not*r man*r put*r asunder.*r
And*p in the house his disciples asked him again of the same matter.
And*p he saith unto them, Whosoever*r shall*r put*r away*r his*r wife,*r and*r marry*r another,*r committeth*r adultery*r against*r her.*r
And*rp if*r a*r woman*r shall*r put*r away*r her*r husband,*r and*r be*r married*r to*r another,*r she*r committeth*r adultery.*r
And*p they brought young children to him, that he should touch them: and his disciples rebuked those that brought them.

But*p when Jesus saw it, he was much displeased, and said unto them, Suffer*r the*r little*r children*r to*r come*r unto*r me,*r and*r forbid*r them*r not:*r for*r of*r such*r is*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
Verily*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Whosoever*r shall*r not*r receive*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r as*r a*r little*r child,*r he*r shall*r not*r enter*r therein.*r
And*p he took them up in his arms, put his hands upon them, and blessed them.
And*p when he was gone forth into the way, there came one running, and kneeled to him, and asked him, Good Master, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?
And*p Jesus said unto him, Why*r callest*r thou*r me*r good?*r there*r is*r none*r good*r but*r one,*r that*r is,*r God.*r

Thou*rp knowest*r the*r commandments,*r Do*r not*r commit*r adultery,*r Do*r not*r kill,*r Do*r not*r steal,*r Do*r not*r bear*r false*r witness,*r Defraud*r not,*r Honour*r thy*r father*r and*r mother.*r
And*p he answered and said unto him, Master, all these have I observed from my youth.

Then*p Jesus beholding him loved him, and said unto him, One*r thing*r thou*r lackest:*r go*r thy*r way,*r sell*r whatsoever*r thou*r hast,*r and*r give*r to*r the*r poor,*r and*r thou*r shalt*r have*r treasure*r in*r heaven:*r and*r come,*r take*r up*r the*r cross,*r and*r follow*r me.*r
And*p he was sad at that saying, and went away grieved: for he had great possessions.
And*p Jesus looked round about, and saith unto his disciples, How*r hardly*r shall*r they*r that*r have*r riches*r enter*r into*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God!*r

And*p the disciples were astonished at his words. But Jesus answereth again, and saith unto them, Children,*r how*r hard*r is*r it*r for*r them*r that*r trust*r in*r riches*r to*r enter*r into*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God!*r
It*rp is*r easier*r for*r a*r camel*r to*r go*r through*r the*r eye*r of*r a*r needle,*r than*r for*r a*r rich*r man*r to*r enter*r into*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
And*p they were astonished out of measure, saying among themselves, Who then can be saved?
And*p Jesus looking upon them saith, With*r men*r it*r is*r impossible,*r but*r not*r with*r God:*r for*r with*r God*r all*r things*r are*r possible.*r
Then*p Peter began to say unto him, Lo, we have left all, and have followed thee.

And*p Jesus answered and said, Verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r There*r is*r no*r man*r that*r hath*r left*r house,*r or*r brethren,*r or*r sisters,*r or*r father,*r or*r mother,*r or*r wife,*r or*r children,*r or*r lands,*r for*r my*r sake,*r and*r the*r gospel's,*r

But*rp he*r shall*r receive*r an*r hundredfold*r now*r in*r this*r time,*r houses,*r and*r brethren,*r and*r sisters,*r and*r mothers,*r and*r children,*r and*r lands,*r with*r persecutions;*r and*r in*r the*r world*r to*r come*r eternal*r life.*r
But*rp many*r that*r are*r first*r shall*r be*r last;*r and*r the*r last*r first.*r

And*p they were in the way going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus went before them: and they were amazed; and as they followed, they were afraid. And he took again the twelve, and began to tell them what things should happen unto him,

Saying,*p Behold,*r we*r go*r up*r to*r Jerusalem;*r and*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r shall*r be*r delivered*r unto*r the*r chief*r priests,*r and*r unto*r the*r scribes;*r and*r they*r shall*r condemn*r him*r to*r death,*r and*r shall*r deliver*r him*r to*r the*r Gentiles:*r
And*rp they*r shall*r mock*r him,*r and*r shall*r scourge*r him,*r and*r shall*r spit*r upon*r him,*r and*r shall*r kill*r him:*r and*r the*r third*r day*r he*r shall*r rise*r again.*r
And*p James and John, the sons of Zebedee, come unto him, saying, Master, we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall desire.
And*p he said unto them, What*r would*r ye*r that*r I*r should*r do*r for*r you?*r
They*p said unto him, Grant unto us that we may sit, one on thy right hand, and the other on thy left hand, in thy glory.

But*p Jesus said unto them, Ye*r know*r not*r what*r ye*r ask:*r can*r ye*r drink*r of*r the*r cup*r that*r I*r drink*r of?*r and*r be*r baptized*r with*r the*r baptism*r that*r I*r am*r baptized*r with?*r

And*p they said unto him, We can. And Jesus said unto them, Ye*r shall*r indeed*r drink*r of*r the*r cup*r that*r I*r drink*r of;*r and*r with*r the*r baptism*r that*r I*r am*r baptized*r withal*r shall*r ye*r be*r baptized:*r
But*rp to*r sit*r on*r my*r right*r hand*r and*r on*r my*r left*r hand*r is*r not*r mine*r to*r give;*r but*r it*r shall*r be*r given*r to*r them*r for*r whom*r it*r is*r prepared.*r
And*p when the ten heard it, they began to be much displeased with James and John.

But*p Jesus called them to him, and saith unto them, Ye*r know*r that*r they*r which*r are*r accounted*r to*r rule*r over*r the*r Gentiles*r exercise*r lordship*r over*r them;*r and*r their*r great*r ones*r exercise*r authority*r upon*r them.*r
But*rp so*r shall*r it*r not*r be*r among*r you:*r but*r whosoever*r will*r be*r great*r among*r you,*r shall*r be*r your*r minister:*r
And*rp whosoever*r of*r you*r will*r be*r the*r chiefest,*r shall*r be*r servant*r of*r all.*r
For*rp even*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r came*r not*r to*r be*r ministered*r unto,*r but*r to*r minister,*r and*r to*r give*r his*r life*r a*r ransom*r for*r many.*r
And*p they came to Jericho: and as he went out of Jericho with his disciples and a great number of people, blind Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, sat by the highway side begging.
And*p when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out, and say, Jesus, thou Son of David, have mercy on me.
And*p many charged him that he should hold his peace: but he cried the more a great deal, Thou Son of David, have mercy on me.
And*p Jesus stood still, and commanded him to be called. And they call the blind man, saying unto him, Be of good comfort, rise; he calleth thee.
And*p he, casting away his garment, rose, and came to Jesus.
And*p Jesus answered and said unto him, What*r wilt*r thou*r that*r I*r should*r do*r unto*r thee?*r The blind man said unto him, Lord, that I might receive my sight.
And*p Jesus said unto him, Go*r thy*r way;*r thy*r faith*r hath*r made*r thee*r whole.*r And immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.
